FF1C7EF2BAC446AE869BCADAF2AEAD1F.description:
Apply responsible legal and ethical behaviors in
the use of technology systems and software.

F2D54A4F261D4873B1E3FA6E50141F65.description:
Use advanced technology tools to create digital
artifacts (e.g. web design, animation, video,
multimedia).

0EF6B4FC021C402BBC915A1B9490254E.description:
Select and apply productivity technology tools to
collect and analyze data, and to record, share,
publish, and present information.

0A0C37E4317A49CBACB69B6F55DF8365.description:
Select and apply the appropriate software to
facilitate collaboration and project management.

AF8D3CD10F074C46BA24E6C37EC1DB42.description:
Analyze and/or design algorithms necessary for
developing solutions to problems.

B9A1449A8B3F40FB8B1C7F047E793B85.description:
Analyze data and identify patterns through
modeling and simulation.

DF98A322ED72494BB5B3B6966D2932E7.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in using a variety of
programming languages to develop solutions to
problems or accomplish tasks.

EAE61A10B83F493B847C3F7D24752D9C.description:
Computational Thinking and Computer Science Applications - Students will be able to apply computational thinking skills and computer science
applications as tools to develop solutions to engineering problems.

500BF03D664E4766ADD021A68C992D9C.description:
Analyze and apply the process and
requirements for LEED certification.

B530A4C057FA4BCCA0922509F92B8937.description:
Design or model buildings that utilize
optimum value engineering.

13F3CD10611D432E8B51FB7B842E3CCC.description:
Design and construct an architectural model
that serves a specified purpose.

1AE4C19BD95B4BDA97ECE2DEEF7804CC.description:
Analyze how architectural designs can
promote human health, well-being and
social interaction.

9A889009F61241F080CDFA9ECDE8A8D2.description:
Design a product using a computer
controlled manufacturing process.

F2E58346CD9949389634762622CA71EC.description:
Evaluate advances in design and
manufacturing technologies.

BC949D2DDA0A4B7394F1BE7153083FE5.description:
Analyze strategies to control quantity and
quality in manufacturing systems.

82FEC90C92424E7BB86360D1F50415C2.description:
Analyze manufacturing systems in terms of
material flow and storage, information flow,
capacities, and times and durations of
events.

C7A045FAE55D4AC0933B7C0068B46F60.description:
Assess the advantages and disadvantages of
a variety of manufacturing systems.

E9F31A16D71F4E9DA85FDA4DEC42FF09.description:
Assess of the role of manufacturing
technologies in society.

B8CE12AFD2FF46F6916D000C44CE5593.description:
Design systems to modify the speed, torque,
or direction of power.

FA915006FB1E459B97D4ED2758BDE5CD.description:
Develop a model of an intelligent
transportation system.

BEBD598C66E34CEC93A91A6ED601AD04.description:
Utilize a variety of systems for controlling
distance and direction of a vehicle,
hovercraft, or other means of
transportation.

04705A6E69BC4BB1AB014224AF8B50D3.description:
Analyze how systems (e.g. structural,
suspension) in vehicles, aircrafts and other
means of transportation impact passenger
and cargo safety.

BD72D31C426A42288E98C19AE2BF9364.description:
Assess the local, national, and global
economic impact of information and
communication technologies.

23D50478946B47F384074A111DFAAEA1.description:
Design and assemble a communication
system to fulfill a specific need.

23969AA32D3F4F17938E9E99318D650E.description:
Analyze factors that impact the design,
development, use, and access to
information and communication
technologies.

6EFFC58BF7A341E1B9E663F07B60F4C0.description:
Assess a variety of communication methods,
techniques, and devices.

F4203C42E6074EFFB400DF95D62CFEB6.description:
Analyze the interconnectivity of
telecommunication, computer, and
audiovisual systems required to access,
store, transmit, and manipulate information.

C83503D0F72741BAB00D303159EB5263.description:
Create models that demonstrate energy and
power flow in electromechnical systems and
optoelectronic devices.

6373524194FF4D4588995CDDEF35EE1D.description:
Create models and design experiments to
improve energy efficiency.

EC23A9ECE1AF4F72A9C5270305284D66.description:
Compare and contrast means to transfer
and store energy.

F96836A19DF9453A80D487EA119E2DDC.description:
Analyze the global production, distribution,
and consumption of energy.

2B09A7A23AD3433A8346C123DC171D9C.description:
Examine renewable and conventional energy
production technologies.

7E97D693ECA94B868E2A339DE2D360BE.description:
Assess the connection between
biotechnology and other fields of study.

BBB3A036CC2746A0B61B0BFFF65CA5AB.description:
Apply biotechnology techniques to assess
how genetic engineering can alter the
function of cellular processes for a specific
purpose.

2F8EA5C01310460F842E961917AD089C.description:
Conduct research on emerging trends in
biotechnology.

F0A220596E5A4F91906FDBB8085A9736.description:
Design and build a model of agricultural
technology that meets a specific need.

974DD1C5B48144A0A24C3565BF08F934.description:
Analyze the advantages and disadvantages
of innovation farming techniques (e.g.
vertical farms, hydroponics, rooftop
farming).

EB4AE2C4A93F451E8C0FF234D90001A0.description:
Assess governmental regulations on
agricultural practices.

865854543313428FBF16CFE5AF9C053E.description:
Assess the impact that technologies such as
automation, sensors, mobile computing, and
telematics have on agriculture.

3DC15A137AFA42F8864AAE964AE2FE5E.description:
Design and build a medical device that
meets a specific medical need.

F351001C525A46938340801249BFF16A.description:
Analyze technological advances that allow
for identification of disease pathogens.

45459803218D42C78A4266BCD11AC458.description:
Analyze and evaluate health data collection
tools (e.g. patient monitoring equipment,
medical wearable devices).

6B95A4840A1D47D3A0864686753C4336.description:
Apply bioinformatics to analyze and
interpret biological data.

9144A71A5AE44AE5A0CA62D8FE304CEF.description:
Describe the application of bioinformatics in
health and wellness.

5C2FFCC5F99044C6BFD6CC74A510108E.description:
Analyze factors that need to be established
to make emerging medical technologies
viable in the marketplace.

F91201479C5049EBB31C572D428E76FA.description:
Assess the social, cultural, political, and
environmental forces impacting the design,
development, application, and access to a
variety of medical technologies.

0861F7E060CD4E91A270D039A8389F20.description:
Apply knowledge of core technologies in the
development of solutions to problems.

30A0538E34664328A47435A575F95311.description:
Core Technologies and The Designed World - Students will demonstrate knowledge of the core technologies that underpin the designed world and
major enterprises that produce the goods and services of the designed world. Core technologies include but are not limited to biotechnology, electrical, electronics,
fluid, material, mechanical, optical, structural, and thermal technologies. Major enterprises include medical, agriculture, biotechnology, energy and power,
information and communication, transportation, and manufacturing and construction technologies.

4D009A0FF0134726956A1272E6B0C30A.description:
Analyze how the engineering code of ethics
impact product design.

C5729E4EA4A54E4B912C43B101258BB8.description:
Implement current industry standard systems
for quality control.

93089A5C3DE3426D8FC7DBBD832E355B.description:
Use assessment techniques to ascertain if a
solution should be pursed to design and
development.

EA4A7396E54347B48B6D9B9D38F014B4.description:
Employ risk analysis to minimize the likelihood
of unwanted side effects.

404C2FA9F455429783FDE0455DE3218C.description:
Evaluate the reliability and validity of
researched information.

35F98129ED784BE7A51D502D728DA806.description:
Document the design process and solutions in
a journal, notebook, or portfolio.

C333791A7D7E4129A789C3324C25043B.description:
Engage in the reverse engineering process to
deduce design features in a novel product.

8A4C94EC16194958B4B5F6348D46C540.description:
Apply the engineering design process to
develop solutions to real-world problems.

A5B7254128584227B5299CCC12A9F6B0.description:
Develop or refine products based on the
results of market research.

CC6CB64A676B43AA906BF544A15A3ED7.description:
Conduct market research to make informed
decisions about product development.

EAB5E42C488C4A7F856A2FCD71C4C13C.description:
Engineering Design and Development - Students will demonstrate knowledge of and apply the engineering design process to develop solutions to
problems.

6B1F07ACA9394C5DA8DCD9208416DBCB.description:
Assess how technology stimulates changes in
society, influence cultural patterns, political
movements, and local and global economies.

56F4E0241086422D8F30B21071BC70C1.description:
Assess the impact that technological invention and
innovation has on economic competitiveness and
shifts in employment opportunities (job creation
and destruction).

BA27F4D2352C4516972E6A0FC1CAC565.description:
Analyze the impact that technology transfer
between societies has on the economy, culture,
and government of each society.

D84BEF4B362C41CBAD16E742C5864651.description:
Explain the ethical considerations that inform the
development, selection, and use of technologies.

5D8DCBCE573540CA9FD99DEC5275677A.description:
Role of Society in the Development and Use of
Technology

18D99B72190B4C81B91C6F861924867D.description:
Weigh available information about the benefits,
risks, costs, and trade-offs of technology in a
systematic way.

53C729E33EDB48218B355E9764801247.description:
Predict future consequences of technological
solutions on a society.

238ADDE075A744E696ACFE3C521AE1E8.description:
Assess the impact of technological advances on
the environment.

BDADDEE4F33042B8A1ED67D0118200F0.description:
Assess the unintended consequences of
technology on a society.

EAD9A10488404810BE2D80AFE4F965CB.description:
Conduct research on technological issues that
currently affect a society.

07F02973600F4F1ABEA34B4A1D1CC7B8.description: Impacts of Technology - Students will evaluate the impact of technology.

F5A2ACE091EA46888B632F5804EE6E22.description:
Analyze and apply the process for protecting
intellectual property.

83B0BA5D64DC4244902C91B5EC6DA525.description:
Collaborate with subject matter experts to
develop solutions to problems.

5B6DACCBCA9F4241BF58D31E930DD4BF.description:
Connections Between Technology and Other Fields
of Study

2262BD73A8ED45D29F935AD067FEEF90.description:
Apply the quality control process to a designed
product.

9D0EB0E7B61B4D119B0A773C3736D88F.description:
Differentiate between quality control and quality
assurance.

B54B9D53847947989A6DE62E0560B53F.description:
Repurpose a technological device for an
application beyond its intended use.

1608A080DFC64E938FAC8DF0C424A49C.description:
Test and evaluate the operation of a system
based on its specified purpose.

93241DBAD83B4EA1A579BDC4C08A37D7.description: Design and create a complex system.

7288013AAC1A40B798ED0C1024884A3F.description:
Create representation of a system in another
form or a higher level of abstraction.

2A5E005919124C878D82DDC9738ECA76.description:
Diagnose a system that is malfunctioning and
use tools, materials, machines, and knowledge
to repair it.

D43CAFCC28C34731A4D333BF2A440261.description:
Use mathematical models and/or computer
simulations to predict the effects of a design
solution on systems and/or the interaction
between systems (HS-ETS 1-4).

26F40D897AB842E08A2D373051787108.description:
Demonstrate how research and development is
a specific problem-solving approach that is used
intensively in business and industry to prepare
devices and systems for the marketplace.

3CAFF55BEDBD4F219C2E980DEEBD684C.description:
Assess factors that shape the design of and
demand for various technologies.

78E63727180D4A8EA6FC122ADE969FD3.description: The Nature of Technology - Students will develop an understanding of the nature of technology.
